intro: Spermacoce vulpina, commonly known as foxbean, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are often clustered in umbels. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce vulpina is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
